intro: Iphigenia sahyadrica, commonly known as the Western Ghats iphigenia, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with white petals and yellow stamens. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. It has hairy leaves and produces small, red fruits that contain a single seed. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from habitat loss and fragmentation.
